business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Devendra Fadnavis-led Maharashtra cabinet expanded, 39 ministers inductedA total of 39 ministers were inducted into the cabinet. Among them, were BJP's Chandrashekhar Bawankule, Pankaja Munde, Nitesh Rane, Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde)'s Gulabrao Patil, Uday Samant, and NCP (Ajit Pawar)'s Dhananjay Munde and Babasaheb Patil.

'Used my son as ATM': Atul Subhash's father accuses daughter-in-law of tortureThe father of the 34-year-old software engineer, who died by suicide in Bengaluru, has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking justice for his son and custody of his grandson.

WPL 2025 Auction: Full updated list of sold players, squad of all five teamsWPL 2025 auction: Five teams picked 19 players and spent Rs 9.05 crore in the auction that took place in Bengaluru on Sunday. Simran Shaikh became the most expensive player after Gujarat Giants bought her for Rs 1.90 crore.

My career made, then unmade by Gandhi family: Mani Shankar Aiyar's big claimMani Shankar Aiyar, 83, claimed that he was not given an opportunity to meet former Congress President Sonia Gandhi for as many as 10 years.

Indian-origin CEO asks if he should get a green card. Elon Musk answersIn a post on X, Indian-origin CEO Aravind Srinivas asked if he should get a green card, prompting Elon Musk to react to his post.

Cyclone Chido: Thousands likely killed in French archipelago, says local prefectCyclone Chido swept through Mayotte overnight, bringing winds of more than 200 kph (124 mph) and damaging makeshift housing, government buildings and a hospital. It was the strongest storm in more than 90 years to hit the islands.

Deeply concerned: Allu Arjun's message for boy hurt in Pushpa 2 screening stampedeActor Allu Arjun said that he was "deeply concerned" about the boy who was injured in the stampede which took place at Sandhya Theatre in Hyderabad.

AAP vs BJP over Rohingya refugees in Delhi: 'False narratives, half truths'Delhi Chief Minister accused the Centre of settling Rohingya refugees in the capital city, while Union Minister Hardeep Puri alleged that it is the Aam Aadmi Party who is using them as a vote bank.

On CCTV: Aspirants storm Bihar exam hall, snatch papers over alleged leaksNewly-surfaced CCTV footage reveals a crowd storming a Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) exam hall, snatching question papers from aspirants taking the test.

Delhi-NCR, Punjab, Haryana shiver as cold wave grips India, dense fog expectedCold wave continues to grip parts of northern India, with dense fog predicted parts of Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh on December 16 and 17.

BJP's Parvesh Verma says he will contest New Delhi seat against Arvind KejriwalParvesh Verma, the son of former Delhi chief minister Sahib Singh Verma, said he will contest the New Delhi seat against AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal.

Tamil Nadu rains: Heavy to very heavy rainfall in these places till December 19The IMD has issued a forecast for heavy rainfall in Tamil Nadu through December 19, with fishermen being warned of adverse conditions. From December 16 to 18, isolated heavy rains are expected to affect several districts, potentially causing traffic disruptions, waterlogging, and damage to crops and infrastructure.

Keerthy Suresh-Antony kiss and dance at their white wedding in GoaActor Keerthy Suresh got married to her longtime boyfriend Antony Thattil on December 12. The actor finally shared pictures of her fairytale-like white wedding by the beaches of Goa.

As winter session washout looms, how BJP MPs have Opposition on backfootSo sharp has been the 'George Soros' offensive that the treasury benches kept the Congress-led Opposition cornered for the whole past week in Parliament

Don't contest elections then: Omar Abdullah on ally Congress's EVM rigging chargeJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah criticised Congress's inconsistency over EVMs, saying parties cannot praise the machines when winning elections and blame them when losing.

D Gukesh on becoming new multi-millionaire: I don't play chess for moneyIndia's D Gukesh joined the ranks of multi-millionaires after winning the World Chess Championship. However, the 18-year-old sensation from Chennai insists that money is not what drives his passion for the game.

Karan Aujla: The singer-writer who drew power from pain to reach stardomKaran Aujla, a prolific songwriter, channelled his pain into music, crafting songs that resonate globally. Though the world has just discovered him, the 27-year-old Aujla has been working in the shadows for a decade now, collaborating with artists like Jassie Gill and Diljit Dosanjh. This is what makes him a rare phenomenon.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Lok Sabha defeats Rajya Sabha in Tuberculosis-awareness friendly cricket matchThe TB awareness match was played between Lok Sabha Speaker's XI led by former Sports Minister Anurag Singh Thakur, and Rajya Sabha Chairman's XI captained by Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju.

Who is G Kamalini? 16-year-old joins MI for Rs 1.6 cr after starring vs PakistanWPL 2025 Auction: Mumbai Indians signed 16-year-old Tamil Nadu all-rounder G Kamalini for Rs 1.6 crore after a bidding war with Delhi Capitals. Kamalini played a crucial innings of 44 runs off 29 balls in a decisive run chase against Pakistan in Kuala Lumpur.

Dr Naresh Trehan recommends cutting out these 4 'whites' from your dietDr Naresh Trehan, Chairman of Medanta Hospital, highlighted the importance of a balanced lifestyle for longevity, advocating moderation in diet and regular exercise for heart health.

Kolkata woman killed, body dismembered by brother-in-law for rejecting advancesKolkata Police arrested Atiur Laskar for murdering his sister-in-law, Khadeja Bibi, after she rejected his advances. He confessed to dismembering her body into three parts, which were recovered from different locations.

Travis Head explains his sensational batting record vs India after Gabba 152 Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia opener Travis Head credited his familiarity with India for his exceptional record, after a stunning 152 off 160 balls on Day 2 of the third Test at Gabba.

Ustad Zakir Hussain, 1951-2024: Life in picsUstad Zakir Hussain, the renowned table maestro, died today, December 15, in the United States due to a heart-related ailment. As the country mourns the loss of the tabla legend, here's a look at his glorious life captured on camera.

Thank you for the joy you brought: Celeb tributes pour in for Zakir HussainRenowned tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, 73, died in San Francisco. Tributes poured in from artists like Zoya Akhtar, Manoj Bajpayee, and Hansal Mehta. He won three Grammy Awards earlier this year.

Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain hospitalised in US for heart-related issuesRenowned tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has been hospitalised in the United States due to serious health concerns. His family has requested prayers and support from well-wishers for his recovery.

sports.headline: IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Live: Rohit, Bumrah in focus as India hunt comebackIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates and Reactions: Australia put themselves in a commanding position on Day 2 with 405 runs on board. India would be hunting quick wickets and hoping to draw level with a strong batting performance on Day 3 of the Gabba Test.

Trailing till 88th min, Man United secure dramatic comeback win vs CityManchester Derby: Ruben Amorim's Manchester United secured a dramatic 2-1 comeback win over Manchester City on Sunday, December 15. Trailing till the 88th minute, Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo scored in the final moments to hand the visitors a sensational win at the Etihad.

Amorim drops Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho from Manchester DerbyMarcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho were dropped from the Manchester United squad in their Derby vs City. Coach Ruben Amorim commented on the snub and stated that he had been paying attention to every single detail.

Watch: Hojlund, Walker involved in heated clash during Manchester DerbyPremier League: Manchester United's Rasmus Hojlund and Manchester City's Kyle Walker were involved in a heated clash during December 15's Manchester Derby. The duo were handed one yellow card each in the first half.

Suryansh Shedge blitzkrieg helps Mumbai win 2nd titleSMAT Final: Mumbai won their second title in the domestic T20 competition by beating Madhya Pradesh in the final. Suryansh Shedge's late heist helped Mumbai trump a heroic knock from RCB's Rajat Patidar.

Bangladesh pacer Nahid Rana receives maiden call-up for West Indies T20I seriesThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has announced the inclusion of 22-year-old pacer Nahid Rana in the T20I squad for the three-match series against the West Indies. This marks Rana's first call-up in the shortest format of the game.

After 5-wicket haul, Jasprit Bumrah eyes Kapil Dev's historic recordIND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah is on the cusp of becoming India's leading wicket-taker in Test cricket on Australian soil. The legendary Kapil Dev currently holds the record with 51 wickets to his name.

India bowlers need to get better with old ball, admits bowling coach Morne MorkelBowling coach Morne Morkel acknowledged that the Indian bowlers failed to execute their plans against Australian centurion Travis Head and urged them to improve their performance with the old ball between overs 50 and 80.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
